page.title: 07RAILWAY LINE
page.content: In our area there is a railway line running from Bristol to Birmingham. It crosses the canal. There used to be a station until the 1930's. The station house is still standing today; it is said to have the old waiting room still intact. The line is used by express trains travelling from the West Country to the North-East of England. Famous trains of the past, such as the "Devonian", roared by to climb the Lickey Incline a little further on, aided by steam banking engines such as the Midland Railway Company's "Big Bertha". Present day diesel hauled trains and Inter-City High Speed Trains do not need help, travelling much faster. The line is busy and several trains pass up and down every hour,both passenger and freight.
